loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Marmarashen village, in the region of Shirak. She is married and has an 11-year-old daughter, who is in the photo with her. Mariam doesn't work, apart from taking care of her daughter, but in order to tackle financial hardships, Mariam is engaged in agriculture.  The family's livestock includes 4 cows and 50 chickens. They also own a plot of agricultural land, where wheat and potatoes are cultivated. Mariam's mother-in-law, who lives with them, helps her a lot with the agricultural work. She gives good advice on how to breed cattle and cultivate seeds.
 
Now, in order to enlarge her farm, Mariam is asking for a loan from SEF International. With the loan's help she will purchase two oxen, seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to cultivate more types of fruits and vegetables and earn more income. Mariam waits for your support!

loans.use: to enlarge her farm, by buying two oxen, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Los Toles Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, “Los Toles”, is located in a rural area of Quiche, in western Guatemala. It is composed of nine women who are amazed that there are kind people from other parts of the world who generously supply capital for small loans.

Josefa is one of these ladies. She is a 30-year-old mother of five children. Her youngest is six months of age and the oldest is 13 years old. Josefa got married when she was 17 years old and a few years ago, she noticed that her husband’s income was not enough for a large family. 

Josefa has been a weaver since she was a child and learned this skill from her own mother. She has always made her own clothes. She decided that she would create an additional business to generate income. Josefa began to raise animals and currently has seven goats and fifty chickens. She realized that she needed a lot more funds to properly feed her animals and approached Friendship Bridge for a loan of USD 640. Josefa also would like to purchase two dozen additional chickens. With any remaining funds, she will buy more thread for her weaving business.

Josefa is quite proud of her achievements and tells us with a smile, "My opportunities were few when I was younger. Today, I realize that a loan can be most beneficial if we know how to manage it. In our monthly trainings with Friendship Bridge, we learn about effective business practices and management, as well as self-esteem, nutrition, and women’s health.”

loans.use: to buy animal feed and two dozen chickens.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en: Douglas is a 36-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 9. He describes himself as committed. He operates a carpentry business where he sells doors, chairs, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are from humble and well-off backgrounds. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital for expansion. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to introduce new products to his carpentry business . His business goal is to open two branches within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to introduce new products to his carpentry business.

loans.name: Yanet Azucena

texts.es:
Yanet es una mujer de 37 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Yanet no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por la orilla de un lago cercano a su hogar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yanet trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella vende frituras como alitas broaster, salchipapas y otros, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yanet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para refaccionar el techado y ponerle piso de concreto a la habitación de sus hijos, de esta manera Yanet podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Yanet, 37, lives in the city of Camaná with her three children who she loves and are her main reason for living.  She’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who focuses all her efforts into moving her family forward since she’s always been both father and mother to her children.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources and the need to start work at a very young age, Yanet was unable to study a professional career.  In her free time she enjoys walking along the shores of a lake near her home and sometimes cooks a delicious Lomo Saltado [strips of sirloin marinated in vinegar, soy sauce and spices, then stir fried with red onions, parsley and tomatoes] to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Yanet works in her small business selling food.  She sells fried snacks like Broaster-style chicken wings, ‘salchipapas‘ [fried sausages with fried potatoes] and others.  She works every day for about 10 hours and thinks she does well because of her tasty cooking and the kind way she treats others.

Yanet is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to make some home improvements because she needs to buy building supplies to repair the roof and to install a concrete floor in her children’s bedroom.  In this way, Yanet will be able to offer greater security and well-being for her family and she can continue working and striving to reach her great dream: to see her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa viene de una familia muy trabajadora, que siempre se esfuerzan por salir adelante y crecer. Está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, con lo cual quiere ayudar a su familia y retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por ella.
Su sueño es poder ser una buena profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas y ser útil a la sociedad.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y también comprar útiles para la universidad.
texts.en:
Elisa comes from a hardworking family that has always strived to grow and move forward. She is studying for a degree in Systems Analysis so that she can help her family and repay them for everything they have done for her.

Her dream is to become a successful professional so that she can help other people and be of use to society. Elisa is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her tuition payments and also buy supplies for her university studies.

loans.use: to pay her tuition and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Alejandra Patricia

texts.es: Alejandra, es una señora de 33 años de edad habitante del barrio Monseñor Lezcano, trabaja en una librería como encargada de venta, es madre de un hijo de tres años de edad con su pareja busca como salir adelante para brindarle a su hijo una mejor condición de vida. Ella desea mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar como: techo, verjas y el piso, es por eso que solicita el apoyo de crédito para empezar a reparar la parte del techo que está en malas condiciones por el sarro, espera ir poco a poco hasta terminar de hacer todas las reparaciones que necesita su hogar ya que solamente con financiamiento podrá realizar esta mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en: Alejandra is 33 years old, and lives in the district of Monseñor Lezcano. She works in a bookshop as a sales assistant, and has a three-year-old child with her partner. She wants to succeed so that she can offer her child better living conditions. She would like to improve the infrastructure of her house, including the roof, railings, and floor. This is why she is requesting the help of a loan to start repairing the part of the roof in a bad state of repair due to a build-up of scale. She hopes to make these improvements little by little until all the necessary repairs her home needs are complete, as it is only through loans that she will be able to make these home improvements.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and beams, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, ages 7 and 10. She describes herself to be a risk taker and innovative. She operates a fish-selling business and has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children comfortably. She also sells charcoal to earn extra income.She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a 21000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is 58 years old and lives in Sevqar village, in the Tavush region. She lives with her husband and son, who is married and has a little daughter. After having been married, Hamest and her husband started an agricultural business. They have a plot of land near their house, where they grow  vegetables. Their son sells these at the local fruit and vegetable markets. Hamest also has a barn for animals, where she breeds cows, chickens and pigs. She is a very hardworking woman, who does her best to provide appropriate living conditions for her family. She runs her farm with great love and care, and from the income that comes from agriculture, meets the family's needs.

Hamest wants to enlarge her farm, and for that purpose she has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Hamest will purchase two more pigs, and forage for feeding them. She hopes to receive more profits from animal breeding in future, and hopes that this loan will bring increased success to her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for two more pigs, and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is requesting a new loan to buy a larger quantity of garlic to sell. Thu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to sell.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is 36 years old and an enterprising man who has been in the business of selling home products and utensils for 12 years. He is giving excellent customer services and his clients are very well satisfied. Arshad has requested a loan of 100000 PKR to purchase new crockery items and utensils so that he could fulfill the demands of customers and increase his sales. Arshad is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items and utensils.

loans.name: Rizwan

texts.en: Rizwan is 31 years old and a hard-working, diligent businessman. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his wife, two daughters and one son. Since 2001, Rizwan has been running a small general store to generate income for his family. He has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand his business. He wants to buy a variety of goods like milk, sugar, rice, soap, detergents and creams and introduce some new items for his general store to fulfill the demands of the customers and to increase his savings. He would reinvest some of the profit in his business and part of it to pay household expenses and for the education of his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. He is very hopeful that the loan would be a productive one for him and his family.

loans.use: To purchase items for his general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of tea leaves to resell to her customers

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 24-year-old man. He has a child who is three years old. He describes himself as being very aggressive. 

He is a hawker and he sells remotes, phone accessories, belts, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are mostly men. 

Robert will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more merchandise (e.g., sugar, cooking oil, salt, bread) for the small shop his wife is running. His business goal is to open a big retail shop within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will build an empire for his family. 

This is Robert's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for a small shop his wife is running.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en: Rubina lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family which consists of her husband and their six children. She is a housewife while her husband is a tailor by profession. He stitches a variety of bags and sells them in the market. This is the only source of income for his family. Her husband needs to purchase rexine (artificial leather) for making bags but, due to a lack of funds, finds it difficult. Therefore, as a member of a two-person lending group, Rubina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase rexine for her husband's work. She hopes that with the anticipated profits, she will purchase an auto rickshaw for her son so that he can generate income, too. Rubina is feeling very happy and thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rexine (artificial leather) for making bags.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 26-year-old, married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

David operates a clothes store where he sells second-hand clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to open a boutique within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He makes charcoal burners, metal doors and metal boxes for sale. This has been his business for the last 12 years. He learned about Milango through friends. He now seeks a loan to buy scrap metals as his raw materials. He also owns a motorbike which he uses to transport people for income. The challenge he faces in the business is the slow season that is usually experienced in this part of the world. Extra income raised from the loan will pay his child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad is 40 years old  and an enterprising man who has been in the business of selling crockery items for 18 years. He is giving excellent customer service and his clients are very well satisfied. Arshad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He would use this loan to purchase new crockery items and utensils so that he could fulfill the demands of customers and his sales would be increased. Arshad is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase crockery items and utensils.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a 33-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a bread supply business, where he sells bread and doughnuts. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his customers are all kinds of people.

He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock for his business, including bread and doughnuts. His business goal is to own a bakery, within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his business, of bread and doughnuts

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es: Don Juan Guillermo, un señor de 57 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Judas de Managua, una zona con pobladores de muy escasos recursos, don Juan se dedica a vender de manera ambulante y en su casa agua y refrescos, nombrados popularmente en Nicaragua como bolsitas o boli, los cuales son empacado en bolsas plásticas selladas labor con el que dio crecer a sus hijos quienes son mayores de edad e independientes, su esposa es ama de casa solamente el cubre los gastos de ambos siendo este su único medio de ingresos, necesita invertir en su pequeño negocio, por lo que solicita apoyo de crédito para comprar materia prima como bolsas y productos para hacer los refrescos, de esta manera seguir adelante.
texts.en: Juan Guillermo, aged 57, lives in the district of San Judas de Managua, an area populated by those with very scarce resources. Juan makes a living selling water and soft drinks in his home and on the street. In Nicaragua, these products are known colloquially as "bolsitas" or "boli"- drinks packaged in sealed plastic bags. With this job, he was able to raise his children, who are grown-up and independent. His wife is a housewife, and he pays both of their expenses, with his sole source of income. He needs to invest in his small business, which is why he is requesting the help of a loan to buy raw materials such as bags and products to make soft drinks, and in this way, succeed.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as bags and products to make soft drinks.

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es: Una viuda muy trabajadora es doña Félix Amada, sus hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes, en la actualidad tiene a su cargo a un nieto a quien apoya con sus estudios, la señora continua con el destace de cerdos para hacer diversas comidas típicas del país como el famoso nacatamal, chicharrones, frito de cerdo entre otros derivados que vende, producto del cerdo, solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio que es su único medio de ingresos durante muchos años, con lo que se ayuda para cubrir sus gastos principales del hogar y también sus medicinas ya que a su edad los malestares van y vienen.
texts.en:
Félix Amada is a very hard-working widow, with grown-up, independent children. She currently looks after a nephew, who she supports in his studies. She still works butchering pork to make various regional foods such as nactamales, a traditional corn-based dish with a filling, wrapped in leaves, pork crackling, fried pork and other pork products which she sells.
She is requesting the loan to invest in the business, which has been her sole source of income for many years, and helps to pay her main household expenses and her medicines, since at her age, she gets the normal aches and pains.

loans.use: to buy pork and vegetables.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be strong and determined. 

She operates a clothes store where she sells second-hand clothes. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular and first-time clients. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. 

Catherine will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more bales of clothes. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be rich. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 46 year old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be credible. She operates a cereal store where she sells maize, beans and millet. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a profitable area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be accessibility to some places due to poor infrastructure. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy maize to sell. Her business goal is to expand and open another store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be self reliant. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Ma. Natividad

texts.en:
Ma. Natividad is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Natividad is 43 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Natividad has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Natividad has requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ma. Natividad has been in this business for 4 years. Ma. Natividad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 40 year old married man with 6 children living in Masindi, Uganda .Hardworking as he is, he decided to start practicing agriculture which he has done for 12 years along side earning a salary as a civil servant. With the proceeds, he has been able to provide basic needs for his children. He has hopes of educating his children to higher levels of learning despite the challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuation. Benson is requesting a loan to buy maize seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy maize seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is a 50-year-old married man with 8 children living in Masindi, Uganda. He drives a special hire taxi, and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and look after the family, since the responsibility solely rests on him.

He hopes to educate his children to the university level, and buy another taxi, despite the high cost of fuel and bad roads .

Siraji is requesting for a loan to buy tires to replace the worn out ones.

loans.use: to buy  tires for his taxi to replace the worn out ones.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is requesting a new loan to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production

loans.name: Sehllin Liseth

texts.es: Sehllin, vive en el barrio Camilo Ortega, una zona donde los habitantes son personas humildes de escasos recursos, ella es una joven madre que busca como salir adelante junto a su esposo e hijos quienes cada vez van creciendo y los gastos de educación son mayores, continua dedicándose al comercio con el apoyo de su esposo, desea invertirle a su venta por lo que solicita el apoyo de crédito para comprar ropa variada de segunda mano y nueva, calzados, utensilios del hogar entre otros, para mantener sus ventas y garantizar el pan de cada día para la familia.
texts.en: Sehllin lives in the district of Camilo Ortega, an area populated by those with scarce resources. She is a young mother who wants to succeed with her husband and children, who grow bigger every day and whose education costs are increasing. She still makes a living in business with her husband's support. She wants to invest in her sales, which is why she is requesting the help of a loan to buy various new and second-hand clothing, shoes, household utensils, and other items, to keep selling and ensure she makes a living for her family.

loans.use: to buy various new and second-hand clothing, shoes, household utensils, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from Ndunyu Njeru. He is 27 years old and not yet married. He has been in this business for the past one year and has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. to enable him buy a dairy cow. He earns an income of KES 20,000 per month. With the anticipated profit, he hopes to buy another dairy cow.

He hopes to be financially stable and support his future family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 25-year-old single lady with one child living in Masindi, Uganda.  She earns a salary as a secretary in the Masindi district. 

Good mother that she is, she has provided her child with all the basic needs on her little salary. She hopes to upgrade her studies and educate her child to the university level, although she is faced with the challenge of low pay. 

Annet is requesting for a loan to pay her school fees.

loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 40-year-old married man with 5 children.  He currently lives in Masindi, Uganda .

James has been a teacher for the last 18 years. Hard working as he is, he has educated his children and built for a house for them.

His vision is to have a stable water supply in his home, and construct a better house, though he faces the challenge of salary delays. 

James is requesting for a loan to construct a water tank.

loans.use: to construct a water tank.

loans.name: Frank Mauricio

texts.es: Frank Mauricio es un hombre de 44 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Hace varios años se dedica a la actividad de la venta de mercancía como comerciante independiente y además es nadador de la liga de natación de Antioquia. Es un hombre con discapacidad visual, pero  eso no lo detiene para ser emprendedor, luchador y muy juicioso. Siente que por ser invidente ha sido excluido de la sociedad, especialmente en el campo laboral, por lo que optó por salir adelante por si sólo y dedicarse a la venta de mercancía y productos de catálogo. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar surtido al por mayor (ropa, tenis, perfumería) ya que le dan mejor precio, para luego venderla a sus familiares, amigos, vecinos y personas del sector. Su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su negocio para que sea estable y le brinde más ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y además poder continuar practicando el deporte que lo apasiona.
texts.en:
Frank Mauricio is a 44-year-old gentleman who is single and has no children. He has been selling merchandise for several years as an independent merchant. Frank is also a swimmer who is part of a swim league in Antioquia. He is visually disabled, but this has not kept him from being a determined and level-headed entrepreneur. Frank feels that being blind has excluded him from society, especially in the workplace. For this reason, he chose to move forward on his own and devote his time to selling merchandise and catalog products.

With the loan he is requesting from Interactuar, Frank plans to buy inventory in bulk (such as clothing, tennis shoes, and perfumes) so that he can get a better price. He will then sell these items to relatives, friends, neighbors, and people in his area. His greatest wish is to strengthen his business so that it will be stable and generate more income to improve his quality of life. Frank also wants to continue practicing his sport for which he has a passion.

loans.use: to buy inventory in bulk such as clothing, tennis shoes, and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, se dedica a su pequeña pulpería con la que intenta salir adelante junto a su familia. Solicita el crédito para invertir de productos el negocio  como granos básicos, reposterías, golosinas, embutidos, entre otros que pueda vender, lo que le permite garantizar los gastos principales del hogar y para poderle brindar los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 29 years old, married, and has a 10-year-old son. She works in her small grocery store with which she trys to maintain her family. 

She is applying for this loan in order to invest in products for her business to sell, such as basic grains, pastries, candies, cured meats, etc., which would allow her to guarantee payment of main household expenses and pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, pastries, candies, cured meats, etc.

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en:
Arshad’s husband is involved in a fruit-selling business. He is 48 years old and is the only earning person in the family.

Arshad is a housewife. She remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Unfortunately, none of them are able to get an education.

Arshad, the leader of Arshad's Group, has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, Arshad's husband will buy fresh, seasonal fruits to sell for profit.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
Jose tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa , ciudad de clima cálido y acogedor, tiene muchos paisajes hermosos y una gastronomía variada. Jose ha atravesado por muchas adversidades, pero ha logrado salir adelante y tal es así que logro estudiar la carrera e ingeniería de sistema y gracias a ello logro obtener un empleo en un institución de su ciudad como vendedor, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, Jose labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y siempre está visitando a cliente, Jose cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas e mejorar cada día.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ay que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería como arroz, fideos, azucar, entre otros; para poder iniciar su negocio de venta e abarrotes, de esta manera podrá tener un ingreso extra y seguir apoyando a su familia y luchar para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un gran empresario”.
texts.en:
José, 26, lives in the city of Pucallpa, a city with a hot, welcoming climate that has beautiful scenery and varied cuisine.  José has undergone many adversities but has managed to get ahead so much so that he succeeded in studying the career of Systems Engineering and thanks to his secured employment as a vendor in an institution in his city.  With the fruits of his labor he’s able to help his parents with household expenses.  José works about 9 hours a day and is always visiting clients.  José believes he’s getting ahead because he’s responsible and above all because he very much wants to improve every day.

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided  he will be able to buy merchandise like rice, noodles and sugar, among others to start a business selling groceries so he can have an additional source of income to continue supporting his family and striving toward reaching his greatest dream: to become a great businessman.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Noel Agustin

texts.es: Noel Agustín mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona donde predomina el comercio de mariscos, Noel es un hombre con ganas de superación para sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles un mejor futuro brindándoles oportunidades que lamentablemente el no tuvo por falta de recursos económicos, Él es propietario de un pequeño acopio de marisco en general como: pescados,curbinas, punches, boca colorada, chanpainanos, conchas, jaibas, camarones, entre otros, Noel Agustín compra a pescadores de la zona y vende  empresas algo grande y a pequeños comerciantes de los mercados de la ciudad el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo y la compra de un termo para  mil libras de mariscos, uno de sus sueños es poder cambiar parte del techo de sus vivienda, Noel agradece mucho el apoyo que les brindan los inversionistas Kivas a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Noel Agustín is a married adult with two minor children.  He’s from the municipality of Chinandega, a zone where seafood commerce predominates.  Noel is a man who very much wants to improve to move his children ahead and provide a better future for them with the opportunities that unfortunately he was unable to have due to the lack of resources.

He owns a small seafood concentrating firm where he gathers up seafood in general like: fish, sea bass, red mouth, clams, crab, shrimp and others.  Noel Agustín buys from local fishermen and sells to large firms and to small merchants in the city markets.  The objective of this loan is to have working capital and to buy a 1000-pound capacity seafood thermos.  

One of his dreams is to replace part of the roof at home.  Noel is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of low economic resources.

loans.use: to buy seafood and a 1000-pound capacity thermos.

loans.name: Qori Chaska De Qollana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORI CHASKA DE QOLLANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Silvia ella es casada y tiene 38 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos como arroz,azúcar,leche y galletas, la socia también tiene un restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja en sus negocios desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia tiene ya sus negocios 8 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus negocios de tienda de abarrotes y el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite para implemetar su tienda de abarrotes.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ganados y negocio de restaurant.


 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Qori Chaska de Qollana.” This bank is located in the district of San Jerónimo in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Silvia; she is 38 years old, is married, and has 4 children. She works in her grocery store business; she sells products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She also has a restaurant, in which she prepares breakfast, lunch, and dinner. She works in her businesses from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. She has had her businesses for 8 years and she does very well. Her dream is to grow her grocery store and restaurant businesses. She requests the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil to stock her grocery store.

The other members have businesses such as raising animals, a grocery store, selling cattle, and a restaurant.

Silvia thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she promises to make her payments when they are due.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Guapas Group

texts.es: Guapas es un grupo solidario muy puntual con sus pagos, tienen 6 ciclos con su crédito. Guadalupe es una se sus integrantes, es una mujer de 40 años, tiene 3 hijos de 25, 12 y 3 años. Se dedica a la venta de tamales por docena y pedidos especiales, tiene cerca de 1 año vendiendo y su hija mayor le ayuda a entregarlos, con el crédito compraran los artículos necesarios para su preparación, como hojas de tamal, masa, guisos, etc. Su sueño es poner un local y ampliarse para tener más clientes.
texts.en:
"Guapas" [Good Looking Women] is a solidarity group that through 6 loan cycles has been very punctual in their payments. Guadalupe, one of its members, is a 40-year-old woman who has 3 children, ages 25, 12, and 3. She sells tamales by the dozen and also fills special orders. Guadelupe has done this for nearly a year now and her older daughter helps her with deliverys.

With this loan, she will purchase the necessary ingredients for preparing tamales, including corn husks for wrapping, corn meal, stew, etc.

Guadelupe's dream is to establish her own stall and to expand in order to have more customers.

loans.use: buy the ingredients for making tamales to sell.

loans.name: Norma Vie

texts.es: Doña Norma, es una madre soltera trabajadora, quien vela por el bienestar de su hija, Norma para mantenerla se vio obligada a dejarla desde muy pequeña para trabajar fuera del país, al ver la mala situación económica de Nicaragua. El crédito que solicita es para ir mejorando su hogar poco a poco ya que su ingreso no le permite realizar estas mejoras de una sola vez. Requiere ponerle cerámica al piso de la casa e inodoro, para gozar de comodidad, más ahora que se encuentra en malas condiciones físicas producto de lesiones en la rodilla.
texts.en: Norma’s a single, hardworking mother who sees to her daughter’s well-being.  In order to support her, Norma had to leave her when she was still a baby and to work abroad because of Nicaragua’s bad economic situation.  The loan she’s requesting is to gradually make some home improvements because her income doesn’t allow her to do all the improvement at one time.  She needs to install tile flooring in the house and toilet to have more comfort more so now that she’s in poor physical condition due to a knee injury.

loans.use: to buy tile, cement, a toilet and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Marybel De Lourdes

texts.es: Maribel, es una madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años que mantener, ella habita en el barrio  La Fuente, su labor es la venta de comida, único medio de ingresos lo cual se le dificulta un poco porque sus hijos tienen necesidades que a veces ella como madre soltera no les puede resolver. Una de las tantas necesidades en el hogar de Maribel es la infraestructura de su casa, la cual es de madera, que al pasar de los años se ha venido deteriorando. El crédito que solicita es para levantar la pared de concreto, que le permitira poco a poco la seguridad en su vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en: Maribel’s a single mother; she has two children who are 8 and 10 years of age she must support.  She lives in the La Fuente neighborhood and she works selling food.  This is her only source of income and it’s difficult because her children have needs that sometimes, as a single mother, she’s unable to meet.  One of the many needs at Maribel’s home is her house’s infrastructure which is wood and over the years has been deteriorating.  The loan she’s requesting is to erect a concrete wall that will make it possible for her to little by little improve her house’s security for her children.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel has a business in Nakuru town where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has six children, of which four are under her support.

She was able to purchase stocks of fruits and vegetables through her previous loan, which boosted her business. She has applied for her second loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables and also cement for a water tank.

Rachel hopes to cement her house and also open a grocery store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Kateebwa Foundation For Financial Assistance Group

texts.en: Koreneri is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is agriculture and he mainly grows coffee. He also has a retail shop in order to boost his income. He has a vision of educating his children to higher levels of learning; however, he faces the challenge of inadequate capital to buy stock. Koreneri is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Rodolfo Benito

texts.es: Rodolfo Benito mayor de edad soltero con dos hijos mayores de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Rodolfo es propietario de un negocio de venta de verduras y frutas como: platanos pipian, ayote, sandias, naranjas, limones, calalas, guayabas etre otros los cuales los ofrece  al por mayor y desmenudeados,  también tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitación la cual ha ido surtiendo pòco a poco debido a que sus ventas de verduras y frutas son productos perecederos, el tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a este negocio, este negocio lo inicia al ver que con su salario de CPF no le cubria con los gastos del hogar por lo que se vio en la necesidad de tener otra fuente mas para sacar adelante a sus hijos que aun estaban bajo su responsabilidad, no es primer crédito que ha tenido ha demostrado en los créditos pasados su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir mas su negocio en la compra de verduras y frutas como: pipián, ayote, chayote, plátanos, sandias, naranjas, guayaba, cálala, limones, y surtir su pulperia ya que esta le estan generando mayores ingresos y su demanda ha crecido en ambos negocios. Rodolfo agradece el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos, comerciantes para obtener un medio digno de vida.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Benito is a single adult with two adult children. He’s from the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country.  Rodolfo owns a business selling fruit and vegetables like bananas, pumpkins, squash, watermelon, oranges, lemons, passion fruit and guavas, among others that he sells at wholesale and retail.  He also has a small grocery store at home that’s he’s been gradually stocking because his fruit and vegetables are perishable items.  He’s been in business for several years now and he started because his salary at CPF was insufficient to cover household expenses so he needed to have an additional source of income to move his children, who were still in his care then, ahead.

This isn’t his first loan; he’s repaid his previous loans on time and responsibly.  He needs this loan to invest in working capital and stock his business better with the purchase of fruit and vegetables like squash, pumpkin, chayote, bananas, watermelons, oranges, guava, passion fruit and lemons and to stock his grocery store since they are producing higher income and demand has grown in both businesses.  Rodolfo is grateful for the support Kiva lenders provide to people of low economic resources, merchants, so that they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and stock merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita earns a living through her food-vending business. She is a married woman and has six grown-up children, from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

Pacita has been engaged in this food-vending business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Pacita is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food-vending, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings. With this loan, she will be able to cook more and sell more food to the people in her place. 

In the future, Pacita hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food-vending, like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, and seasonings.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 44-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a metal-working business, where he makes and sells metallic jikos. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area, and his customers are all kinds of people. He says that his biggest business challenge is a lack of capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to improve and expand the business, by buying metal sheets and other materials for making jikos. His business goal is to own another shop, within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to improve and expand the business, by buying metal sheets and other materials for making more jikos

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has two children, aged 5 and 10 years. She describes herself as aggressive, results-oriented, and a go-getter. She operates a fruit juice business, where she sells juices and whole fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She says that her biggest business challenge is obtaining the fruits with which to make juice.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to rent a bigger space in which to conduct the business. Her business goal is to begin packaging her products and selling them to supermarkets, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger business and offer job opportunities to other people. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to rent a bigger space in which to conduct the business of selling fruit and fruit juices

loans.name: Vilma Janet

texts.es: Vilma reside en el sector del Fortín que pertenece a la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, actualmente vende arroz por quintales, este negocio surgió de una oportunidad que se les presento por casualidad ya que tenían un dinero ahorrado que lo destinarían para seguir construyendo su vivienda, pero les resulto muy bien y ahora tienen muchos clientes a quienes les entregan en su domicilio. Su sueño es en unos cinco años comprar una camioneta para distribuir el arroz a negocios. El préstamo sera destinado para la compra de quintales de arroz.
texts.en: Vilma lives in the city of Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She currently sells rice by the quintal, a business that arose from an opportunity that came up by chance since they had money saved up that they were going to use to make home improvements.  But, it turned out very well and now they have many customers that they home deliver to.  Her dream in about five years is to buy a pick-up truck to distribute rice to businesses.  This loan will be used to buy quintals of rice.

loans.use: to buy rice by the quintal.

loans.name: Kairuni Group

texts.en:
Kairuni is a group of women farmers practicing potato and dairy farming.  The members live in Meru, near Mt. Kenya in Eastern Kenya.  The region is very productive for dairy farming due to the favorable weather conditions.  Most families in the region have between two and ten cows, and therefore the sale of milk becomes their main source of income, alongside potato farming.

The women of Kairuni are very hardworking and take care of their families from the little income they get.  However, they are highly challenged when it comes to getting fuel for cooking.  Their homes are not connected to the electricity grid, and purchasing LPG gas is too expensive for them.  They therefore use firewood, charcoal, and kerosene for cooking and lighting.  It costs between $25 and $58 US to purchase charcoal and kerosene each month, and firewood from the nearby forests is highly guarded and restricted to ensure conservation, so getting firewood is also a challenge.

To overcome these challenges, VEP taught them that they could install biodigesters and use cleaner, better fuel that is also efficient without incurring on-going costs.  To enable them to undertake this project, they have all benefited from this loan and construction has been initiated.  With a biodigester, they will have increased savings that enable them to repay the loan and improve their lives.  They can also spend more time with their families in place of the time previously spent collecting firewood.  Bioslurry from the biodigester will also come in handy to replace commercial fertilizers in potato farming, hence increasing production and ensuring food security.

The group is usually represented by Madam Amaria who is seated second from the left. She is the group chair and the most educated. She is also the one who motivates and urges the group to embrace change. with her leadership the group will grow through many other projects as well.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita tiene 43 años de edad esta casada con el señor Juan Paulino, con quien tiene una hija que esta estudiando la secundaria. La señora Margarita desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos personales como son perfumes, cosméticos y joyería, y su esposo el señor Juan Paulino es empleado de una empresa transportista como chofer de una camión de carretera.
Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo más variedad de ropa y que sea de temporada de verano.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es para pagar el crédito y que con el sueldo de su esposa es para pagar los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejorar la calidad de mercancía y ofrecerles a sus clientes calidad de ropa para que la puedan recomendar.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is 43 years old and married to Sr. Juan Paulino. They have a daughter who is in high school. For the past four years, Sra. Margarita has been selling used clothing and personal products such as perfumes, cosmetics, and jewelry. Her husband, Sr. Juan Paulino, is employed by a transportation company as a truck driver.

Margarita and her husband are requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of merchandise that her customers have requested. She will buy a wider variety of clothing for the summer season. With the profit she earns from her sales, Margarita will be able to repay the loan. Her husband’s salary will be used to pay for family and school expenses.

Margarita wants to improve the quality of the merchandise she offers to her customers. By offering quality clothing, her customers will be able to recommend her.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Olga Liliana

texts.es: Olga reside en la ciudad de Quevedo – Ecuador, es la hija menor de una numerosa familia, desde muy corta edad tenia muchos deseos de superación, con mucha motivación y esfuerzo emprendió la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, el mismo que lo atiende de lunes a sábado, los días domingos de dedica asiste a un centro de estudios, el préstamo lo destinara a la compra de ropa, productos de belleza y una vitrina, sus sueño es tener un negocio en su domicilio.
texts.en: Olga lives in the city of Quevedo, Ecuador.  She’s the youngest daughter in a very large family and since she was little she’s had a strong drive for self-improvement.  With much motivation and effort she started to sell clothes and beauty products Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays she attends school.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, beauty products and a display case.  Her dream is to have a home-based business.

loans.use: to buy a display case, clothes and beauty products.

loans.name: Benita Santa

texts.es: Benita reside en el sector del Fortín que pertenece a la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, actualmente vende ropa, zapatos y otros artículos que le soliciten los clientes, este negocio lo emprendió gracias a la motivación de una vecina ya que Benita tenia antes un pequeño restaurante, la venta de sus productos la realiza fuera de la ciudad para lo cual tiene que realizar viajes los fines de semana con el objetivo de visitar diferentes pueblos, su sueño a mediano plazo es adquirir una camioneta para poder viajar a mas ciudades y llevar mas mercadería, con el préstamo actual comprara mas mercadería.
texts.en: Benita lives in Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She currently sells clothes, shoes and other items customers request.  She started this business thanks to encouragement from a neighbor since Benita used to have a small restaurant.  She sells her products outside the city which means she has to make trips on weekends to visit various towns. Her dream for the medium run is to acquire a pick-up truck to be able to visit more cities and take her merchandise.  She will use the current loan to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork, junket and cheese.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario wants to prove that being a farmer does not mean that you cannot succeed. He is doing his best to become one of the successful farmers in their village. Through his profit from farming, he is able to support the education of his children.  

Mario is a rice grower. He admits that he has difficulty in financing his farming needs since his priority is the education of his children. Because of this, Mario is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay labor costs for land preparation. He is positive that having this capital will make his business grow and be profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Betzy Cecilia

texts.es: Betzy reside en el sector del Fortín de la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, inicio su negocio hace tres años, desde temprana edad le gustaba todo lo relacionado a la costura y el diseño de ropa, con el préstamo desea comprar telas y una maquina industrial.
texts.en: Betzy resides in Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She started her business three years ago.  From a very young age she’s liked everything related to sewing and clothing design.  She wants to use the loan to buy fabric and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.use: to by an industrial sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 21 years old and he is a student of Yerevan European Academy, the faculty of Economics and Management, with the specialty of International Economic Relations (paid division). 

Martin lives in the village of Tsovagyugh, which is in Gegharkunik region. He lives with his mother and school-age sister. Martin’s father is in the Russian Federation, in a job abroad, the income of which is a little help with the family's numerous needs. 

They also have some income from farming and agriculture. They have three cows, one bull, two calves, five sheep, and three lambs. On a small plot of land, Martin’s mother cultivates cucumbers, tomatoes, strawberries, currants, and blackberries for the family's use. 

It is obvious that it is very hard for Martin’s family to pay for his education. Martin asks a loan of AMD 225,000 (Armenian drams) to pay his tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 33, is from Ndunyu Njeru, in Kenya. He is married to Joyce, and they have one child. 

John has a carpentry business, which he has operated for the past four years. His business generates a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings.
 
John has applied for his second loan from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. This loan will enable him to buy timber after paying back his previous loan.

John's anticipated profit will be used to purchase materials for his business. He hopes to own the best workshop in his area in the near future.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Mayra Jacqueline

texts.es: Mayra reside en la ciudad de Quevedo – Ecuador, desde temprana edad le gustaba todo lo relacionado a la belleza y el arte culinario, decide iniciar su propio local de venta de comida y un salón de belleza en sociedad con su hermana, con el préstamo desea comprar implementos para el salón de belleza y su sueño es que su negocio sea reconocido en la ciudad y posteriormente brindar servicios de SPA.
texts.en: Mayra lives in the city of Quevedo, Ecuador.  From a very young age she's liked everything related to beauty and to culinary arts.  She decided to open a business selling food and in partnership with her sister has a beauty salon.  She wants to use the loan to buy supplies for the beauty salon and her dream is that the business becomes well-known in the city and later on to provide spa services.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is 33 years old. She lives in Dzirula village, Zestaponi district with her parents. Maka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Maka’s father is an artisan. He is working on house renovations and constructions from private orders to earn a small income for the family. This is the only source of income for them.

Maka requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit, Maka will start trading with clothes. She will purchase clothes at wholesale prices from the big market and start reselling them among her villagers with a price markup. She will try to work as hard as she can to earn a good profit. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the same business, in order to expand her trading, and another part will be used for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading with clothes.

loans.name: Abdel Halim

texts.en:
Abdel Halim, 56, is married and the father of six children. He owns a small shop in his village, where he sells European clothes and shoes. His wife helps him run the store. 

One of his children is still enrolled in public school to receive the education his parents did not have the opportunity to acquire; Abdel Halim's highest degree is from intermediate school. 

Abdel Halim contacted Al Majmoua because he needs to enhance and expand his business, which he started only two years ago. In fact, he needs the loan to purchase the summer collection and raise his revenue. 

As for the future, Abdel Halim hopes to further develop his business by setting up an appropriate decor that would be suitable to the merchandise he offers.

loans.use: to purchase the summer collection and raise his revenue

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: María, de 39 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes como empleada domestica y los fines de semana vende carne, de esta manera María intenta salir adelante con sus tres hijos quienes van a la escuela y para ella es prioridad garantizar su educación, comparte los gastos del hogar con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil. María desea empezar a construir las paredes de su casa de concreto, es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para empezar la obra, esto le permitirá un hogar seguro para sus hijos y evitara la filtración de agua cuando llueve.
texts.en:
María, who is 39 years old, lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. She works from Monday to Friday as a domestic employee, and on the weekends, she sells meat. In this way, María tries to provide for her three children, who are in school; guaranteeing their education is a priority for her. She shares the household costs with her husband, who works in construction. 

María hopes to begin building the concrete walls of her house. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to start the project. This will allow her to have a safe home for her children and keep out the water when it rains.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, and blocks.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Un joven que busca como salir adelante junto a su familia es Danilo, quien es casado y tiene  un hijo a quien mantener por quien trabaja sin descanso para lograr darle sus estudios, mientras el trabaja como despachador en una ferretería su esposa se encarga de una pequeña pulpería a la que desea invertir para continuar vendiendo, siendo sus principales clientes los vecinos del barrio donde habitan.
texts.en: Danilo is a young man who fights to get ahead with his family. He's married, has one child and works very hard to provide him with studies in the future. He works as a salesman in a hardware store, while her wife runs a small grocery store, where he wants to invest. Their main clients are their neighbors.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sodas, canned products and toiletries, among others.

loans.name: Maria Gisella

texts.es:
María reside en el sector del Fortín de la ciudad de Guayaquil – Ecuador, su negocio lo inicio hace cuatro años, se dedica a la venta de productos cárnicos, esta actividad inicia  desde las 06
:00 hasta las 12:00. el préstamo será destinado para realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, su sueño a corto plazo es hacer su casa de hormigón armado y tener un local para iniciar un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
María lives in Guayaquil, Ecuador’s El Fortín sector.  She started her business four years ago selling meat products; she’s open for business from six until noon.  

The loan will be used to make some home improvements. Her short-term goal is to build her house out of reinforced concrete and to have a space in which to start a beauty salon.

loans.use: to make some home improvements.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, age 27, runs an electronics shop in Kiambu to earn a living. She also offers photocopying and typing services. She earns a monthly income of 50,000 shillings from her business.

Jane and her husband John have two children. 

This will be Jane’s second loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy photocopy paper and electronic items for her store. 

In the future, she hopes to see her business prosper so that she can better provide for the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: to buy photocopy paper and electronic items for her store

loans.name: Nancy Jessica

texts.es: Nancy reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador,  su negocio inicio hace varios años por que tenían pocos ingresos económicos en el hogar, se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa, atiende el negocio sola porque su esposo trabaja, el préstamo lo destina para la compra de ropa, zapatillas y pantalones, su sueño e terminar de construir la casa y contar con un local para que funcione un bazar.
texts.en: Nancy lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  Her business started several years ago because they had little income at home.  She works making and selling clothes.  She tends to the business by herself because her husband works.  She will earmark the loan to buy clothes, sandals and pants.  Her dream is to finish building her house and to have a space where a clothing store can operate.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sandals and pants.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty-nine years old and single, she has two children who are both adults.  She is a farmer in Ndumberi in the outskirts of Kiambu town and has been in this business for five years and earns an income of twenty eight thousand shillings.

This will be Jane’s second loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy piglets and renovate her cattle shed. In the future she wants to fully provide for her family, increase the milk supply and become a successful pig farmer.

loans.use: to buy piglets and renovate her cattle shed.

loans.name: Presily

texts.en:
Presily earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She lives with her husband and five children in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able expand her inventory and attract more buyers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara, age 25, is a maize farmer. She grows maize on a half hectare of agricultural land, then harvests and sells the produce locally. She lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District with her two daughters and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Their income barely provides enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tamara would like to start up a family dairy farm business. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up purposes, but without success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

She has now requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products because they are perceived as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With the received credit, Tamara will purchase a milking cow. Once the milking cow is purchased, Tamara will produce dairy products to offer for sale. In an effort to earn additional income, she will also purchase clothing items to offer for sale. These investments will increase the income of her family. 

Tamara's new business initiatives, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow, as well as clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a hardworking Iraqi youth client who is 26 years old, married and a father of a single child. Yaser works to provide the family income while his wife takes care of their child.

Yaser owns a small workplace where he specializes in printing and photocopying documents. In his shop, Yaser also sells mobile phones and recharging cards. He established his business in 2009 and since then, this business has been the source of living for his family. Yaser gained good experience in the neighborhood and is well known with an excellent reputation, thanks to his providing services.

Yaser is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a new photocopying machine. He believes that this loan will help him in the growth of his business and will increase his revenues. It will also grant him the ability to give the best living standards to his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy a new photocopying machine.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is 34 years old. She lives in Chabinaani village, Akhmeta district with her parents and 13 year old son. Khatuna has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a vineyard. With the harvested grapes they produce wine and sell it at the local markets to earn a small monthly income. Their additional income is Khatuna’s father’s salary. He is an artisan and works on private orders on house constructions and renovations. 

Khatuna requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Khatuna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. These poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her credit Khatuna will start trading with clothes from Turkey. She will go there to purchase products at the wholesale price, bring it to her village and sell with the price marked-up among the villagers. Khatuna will earn a profit and reinvest it in her business to have better choice to offer to her clients. She will earn an additional income for the family and will be able to provide better a life for them.

loans.use: to start trading with clothes from Turkey.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo – Ecuador, Por la falta de trabajo y por consejos de la familia instalo una lavandería en su domicilio, donde inicia la atención a partir del medio día, con el préstamo desea comprar una secadora y unos tanques, su sueño es tener una lavandería mas grande, que su hija estudie enel extranjero y que su esposo tenga un taller de elaboracion de maquinas para helados.
texts.en: Gloria lives in the city of Portoviejo, Ecuador.  Because of the lack of employment and on advice from the family she opened a laundry at home where she starts work at noon.  She wants to use the loan to buy a dryer and some tanks.  Her dream is to have a bigger laundry, that her daughter studies abroad and that her husband has a workshop to manufacture ice-cream making machines.

loans.use: to buy a dryer and tanks.

loans.name: Ferzana

texts.en:
Ferzana is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been operating a business of selling bangles for one year in order to contribute to her family's income. Her husband has a job in a factory but makes an insufficient amount of income to fulfill the demands of his family. 

Ferzana offers various types of bangles in different colors and sizes to the people of her community. She also sells the sets of bangles in the market at reasonable rates. For the further improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more variety of bangles in various sizes, colors and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of bangles in various sizes, colors and designs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10kgs of fish.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is a 45-year-old single woman who lives in a Palestinian camp in southern Lebanon, just like other Palestinian refugee seeking peace in Lebanon. She owns a small tailoring business and sells her products. She has been working in this field for about 15 years. 

The dire living conditions in the camp are a burden on her shoulders and her father's, whom she lives with, because owning a small business in such a place is not very profitable. She decided to contact Al Majmoua to acquire a loan to help her purchase a new sewing machine and embroidery pieces. 

As for the future, Kamila wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and embroidery pieces

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 61-year-old, married mother of five children who are all also married. She owns a small business based in her house where she cooks home-made food, and sells dresses that she makes. Her husband is a school bus driver. Their income is very low, which is why it is very important for her to enhance and expand her business. In fact, this is why she contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a loan. She will use the loan and invest in a car because it will help her transport merchandise and products throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport merchandise and products throughout the city.

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Leonarda tiene 52 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Pascual, con quien tiene tres hijos a quienes les han dado lo mejorar para salir adelante.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le esta haciendo falta la losa de concreto en el patio trasero de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y que el señor Pascual se encargara de realizar la mejora en horarios adicional a su empleo.
La señora Maria Leonarda trabaja de limpieza en casa particulares y su esposo el señor Pascual tiene como contratista en una compañía de construcción de viviendas. Ambos se han esforzado mucho para mejorar su calidad de vida y así como mejoramiento del patrimonio que planean dejarles a sus hijos.
Con el sueldo que recibe la señora Maria Leonarda es para pagar el crédito y que con el ingreso del señor Pascual es para los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Maria Leonarda is a 52-year old woman who is married with Mr. Pascual. They have three children to whom they have provided with the best. She's requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials to build a cement ceiling for their rear patio. Mr. Pascual will make the improvement during his spare time. 

Maria Leonarda works cleaning houses and her husband is a contractor in a housing construction company. They have both worked very hard to improve their quality of live and to improve the patrimony that will go to their children. They plan to use Maria Leonarda's salary to repay the loan and Pascual's salary to cover household expenses and tuition.

loans.use: to build a ceiling made of cement.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer, age 25, earns a small income as an employee in the public sector. This is the only source of income for his family. He and his wife have a young daughter and live in the city of Rafah.
 
Tamer has requested a loan from FATEN because he would like to buy a new laptop computer. This investment will allow him to read articles and news items so that he can stay educated in current developments. He will also use the laptop to communicate with his friends and family. 
  
Tamer would like eventually to open his own business project in the future by taking out another loan from FATEN.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his personal use

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pedro O., habita en el municipio de Masaya con sus familia, el sueña con poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, desde hace muchos años atras el se dedica al cultivo de Yuca, actualmente requiere de capital para estableser dos manzanas de yuca, el terreno ya lo tiene limpio y preparado, c on este credito compra los insumos y fertilizantes necesario, ademas comprara la madera de  yuca para sembrarla, Agredece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado todos estos años.
texts.en:
Pedro O. lives in the municipality of Masaya with his family. His dream is to be able to improve their living conditions. He has earned his living cultivating cassava for many years. 

Pedro currently needs capital to establish two “manzanas” [a unit of measurement equal to 1.72 acres] of cassava. He already has the land cleared and prepared; with this loan, he will buy the necessary supplies and fertilzers. In addition, he will buy the cassava cuttings to plant. 

He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided him all these years.

loans.use: to maintain his crops

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es: El Sr. Marcos, padre responsable que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y con su labor como guarda de seguridad se ayuda para los gastos de escuela de ellos , solicita el préstamo para realizar compra de materiales de construcción para realizar un anexo de porche en su casa de habitación, ya que este esta en muy malas condiciones, don Marcos agradece el apoyo de financiamiento ya que con ello podrá mejorar su nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is a responsible father who safeguards the wellbeing of his children; his work as a security guard helps with their educational expenses. He is requesting the loan to make a purchase of construction materials in order to add a porch onto his house, since his is in very bad condition. 

Marcos is grateful for the financing support since it will enable him to improve his and his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, rebar, and blocks.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven grown children. Farming is their main source of income.

Ponciana works hard to support her husband on their farm. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Ponciana hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Armenio

texts.en:
Armenio owns six hectares of rice field within his locality. He has managed this kind of business for 32 years. He is a hardworking father and responsible husband. He is happily married and has been blessed with three children.

Armenio would like to seek additional capital of PHP 30,000 due to the many hectares of rice field he operates. He will use this amount to buy essential insecticides and fertilizer to keep his rice field productive. Armenio knows that this loan will have much to do with the improvement of his rice crops because he could nourish them with complete farm supplies. He just hopes and prays that lenders will grant his requested amount of loan so he could sustain his family's well-being and send his three children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to improve his rice farming business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is a married woman and has four children.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, and snack foods. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks and attract more customers and buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, candies, soda, noodles, biscuits, and snack foods.

loans.name: Rapig

texts.en:
Rapig is 43 years old. He lives in a small village of Bolnisi District with his wife and mother, who is provided with a retirement pension.
