Her spouse brutally deceased following a cardiac illness. The client is a seller of clothing and shoes. She sets up her merchandise along the street and sometimes at her home. She started her business with a loan from the MFI Hekima, about 7 years ago. She will use this new loan to buy 6 pieces of pagnes [colorful African fabric]. Thus, she hopes to grow her capital, school her children and buy a plot of land for her children. Finally, she hardily thanks Hekima for its microloan support to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 6 pieces of pagnes [colorful African fabric].

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en: Reyhan, 57, is a married woman. She is a kind and industrious person. She has two children, one married daughter and a 21-year-old son. She sells food in a food stall. She sells a variety of foodstuffs, including dumplings, flat breads, and sweets. With the support of her husband, during the past 10 years she has gained much business experience in her field. With the profits earned from the business, she funded the wedding parties of her daughter and provided her with a dowry. She is an intelligent and brainy woman who says, "I will do all the best for my family." She is requesting a loan to purchase food ingredients to resell at her stall, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, sugar, and beans. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients to resell at her stall.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz, 30, is a married woman. For about 5 years, has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater more consistently to her customers. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela de 27 años, está casada y tiene una hija de 5 años con quien vive en la casa de sus padres.La agricultura es su principal actividad económica, por eso tiene que atender a sus cultivos de arvejas, habas, maíz, y otros, con el apoyo de su esposo.“El trabajo del campo es cansado pero veo que vale la pena tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. En sus 5 años como agricultora aprendió de las peripecias que el clima y la falta de lluvias pueden provocarle, por eso ahora sale muy temprano de su hogar para llevar agua hacia sus cultivos mediante canales de agua que ella misma abre en el campo. Ahora piensa en sembrar arvejas y habas, porque se acerca la temporada de cosecha, donde los precios serán buenos. Tiene planeado alquilar un terreno más para sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo financiero recibido ya que asi podrá seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Gisela invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Gisela, 27, is married and has a five-year-old daughter with whom she lives with in her parent's house. Agriculture is her main economic activity and that is why she must take care of her crops; peas, beans, maize, and others, with the support of her husband. “Field work is tiring but I see that it's worth all the effort." she says. 

In her 5 years as an agriculturist, she has learned about what the unexpected weather and lack of rain can cause. For that reason she now leaves home very early to water her crops by means of water channels that she herself opens in the field. Now she is thinking about planting peas and beans because the season of harvest is approaching, where the prices will be good. She is planning to rent more land to plant a greater amount. 

This it is her second loan with KIVA and she is thankful for the financial support she has received since she will be able to continue on. In addition she is committed to paying her monthly payments on time. Gisela will invest 1000 Peruvian Soles to purchase organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Llapanchispac Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHISPAC”; Este banco se ubicado en  la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Graciela, la socia tiene 31 años es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de vidrieria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos y tamaños de vidrios para las distintas personas que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de vidrios para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de verduras, restaurante, crianza de animales menores, vidriería, elaboración de proyectos, docentes, maestro constructor.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the communal bank Llapanchispac, located in the Cusco Province in the Cusco Department. The featured member is Graciela, 31, who lives together with her partner and has a child aged one. Graciela alternates her daily activities with her glass selling business. She has been running this business for some time now, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She sells different kinds of glass of different sizes upon clients' requests. She is a responsible and determinate person, this being the way she supports her family. Graciela is applying for this loan in order to buy glass for her business. 

The other members' businesses include selling vegetables, restaurant, small animal husbandry, glass selling, project development, teaching, and construction work. The member shown in the inset photo asked for permission to be late to the meeting because of work commitments. The person who appears with a covered face is not a member of this communal bank. 

Graciela is grateful to those who contribute to her dream through the loan program, and she pledges to make her repayments as agreed.

loans.use: to buy glass for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is married with four children. She is 55 years old, and resides at Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Rosalinda owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for many years. Each month, she earns 9,800 PHP. In order to establish another rice farming plot, she borrowed a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit. In the future, Rosalinda wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to establish another rice farming plot.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam, 35, is a married woman and mother of two children. The man in the photo is Maryam’s husband, who is a driver by profession, providing transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the past four years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Maryam has applied for a loan of 15,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Maryam is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 55-year-old married woman, and the mother of two. She has been running a business selling fabric for many years; she purchases  a variety of fabrics from the main city, and then sells them to people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality fabric in her community. 

To increase her sales, Shamshad requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of fabric in different colors. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fabric in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, 48, is a married woman and is running a general store business. Her husband is a teacher but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. Naseem contributes much in the family income to support her children. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. To full stock her store, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is a 35-year-old married lady who enjoys her work doing hand embroidery. She started working with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

Meena makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to develop a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of pearls, sequins, and stones for the embellishment of her hand embroidery. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. 

She hopes to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. 

Meena dreams of her children's bright future, and she is very thankful to the Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of pearls, sequins, and stones for embellishment of her hand embroidery.

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en:
Mr.Enhzaya is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Tseveendulam runs their family business of wooden furniture manufacturing at home. His three children study at local schools. 

He built a small workplace on their plot of land and produces a variety of custom wooden furniture to sell to local clients. 

He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to start to sell his products in a rental stall at a local construction supplies market where all the furniture and construction related goods are sold. His wife will be operating sales. 

He is hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to start to sell his products in a rental stall at the local construction supplies market.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 43 years old.  She is married, and they were blessed with eleven children. She and her husband are in a fish vending business and glad they can earn a daily net income of PHP 1,000.  

She wanted her business to grow, and this is the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fish and seafood to sell in their village. 

She is hoping her requested loan will be granted so she can make her business profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fish and seafoods to sell

loans.name: Jalakanya Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Puspanjali, of Bissam Cuttack village in the Rayagaga district in Odisha, formed a group with three other women of her locality named “Jalakanya” with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation. The lady standing at the extreme right raising her hand in the photo is Puspanjali. 

She is a 38-year-old single woman living with her son, age 7 years. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line family (BPL), a segment living on less than a dollar a day. 

Puspanjali started her leaf plate business four years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. She makes plates woven out of dry leaves at her house and local traders in the village come and collect them every week. She makes 1,000 to 1,500 plates each week. These plates are biodegradable, disposable, hygienic, and an inexpensive alternative to modern paper or plastic utensils. These are widely used by local food stalls and hotels to serve food. She gets her supply of leaves and bamboo twigs used for stitching from local sellers in the market and sun-dries them for two days to make them ready to be stitched. 

Currently, the stock she buys from the local sellers is enough for her to make plates for one day and sell the next day. She wants to have enough stock to support her business during the monsoon as well when she cannot get dry leaves. The present loan will be used by her to buy more stock of leaves and bamboo twigs. 

Puspanjali dreams of building a small concrete house for her family and giving proper education to her son. Puspanjali says, “By successful management of my loans, I have gained more confidence in myself, and I hope that I can do even better to support my family in future.” 

The other three members of the group, Banalata, Ramadebi and Sandhya are running a leaf plate making and selling business, a tea stall and a vegetable vending business, respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of more stock of leaves and bamboo twigs.

loans.name: Ashran

texts.en: Ashran is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of sewing clothes for the last three years. She sews for the people of her community and also takes orders from a nearby boutique. She knows sewing techniques very well and makes enough through her business. To meet the orders of her customers on time, she applied a loan of PKR 15,000 through Kashf Foundation. This will help her to buy spools of thread in various colors, as well as buttons, laces and ribbons. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings and wants to use part of the revenues to provide good quality education to her children. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread in various colors, as well as buttons, laces and ribbons.

loans.name: Hajra

texts.en: Hajra is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She is very talented and excels in her work of making envelopes. She makes a large quantity of envelopes at home and sells them in the local market. She makes enough through her business to meet the basic needs of her children. To help her continue the operations of her business, Hajra is applying for a loan of 10,000 PKR, which she will use to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her sales. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business. She wishes to use the part of profits to provide a good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bundles of good quality paper to increase her production and sales of envelopes.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile and productive area along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has four children, of whom two are of school-going age. She has been practicing farming for over 20 years. Her main sources of income are cash crops and horticultural crops. She says that this loan will help her buy dairy goats, which will boost her income level and hence improve their living standards. The challenges she faces are lack of sufficient funds and poor markets. She wants to have a cooling plant of her own for goat's milk in five years’ time. She appreciates Juhudi’s funding her.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats for her farm.

loans.name: Chatrapati Group

texts.en:
This group is called Chatrapati. It was formed in the year 2010. Its five members are all women from the village Bissam Cuttack. It is located in the district of Rayagada, one of the poorest districts in India. Gouri is one of the members of this group. The lady standing extreme right raising her hand in the photo is Gouri. 

She is 31 years old, living with her husband, one daughter, age 3 and one son, 8 months old. She has been involved in the leaf plate business for the last 10 years. She makes plates woven out of dry leaves at her house and local traders in the village come and collect them every week. She makes 1,000 to 1,500 plates in a week. These plates are biodegradable, disposable, hygienic, and an inexpensive alternative to modern paper or plastic utensils. These are widely used by local food stalls and hotels to serve food. 

Gouri gets the supply of the leaves and bamboo twigs used for stitching from the local sellers in the market and sun-dries them for two days to make them ready to be stitched. Currently, the stock she buys from the local sellers is enough for her to make leaves for one day and sell the next day. She wants to have enough stock to support her business during the monsoon as well when she cannot get dry leaves. So the present loan will be used by her to buy more stock of leaves and bamboo twigs. This additional income will supplement her income during bad weather times when it might be difficult to dry leaves. 

Gouri dreams of building a small concrete house for her family and giving a proper education to her children. 

The other four members of her group are Pramila, Rabannama, Jaya and Lalita who are running a transporting business with leaf plate trading, a milk business, a tailoring centre and a laundry business, respectively. Since the formation of Chatrapati, all members of the group have been working hard and continue to work with unity, honesty and sincerity.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of more stock of leaves and bamboo twigs.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en: Sumaira, age 31, is the leader of this borrower group. She is a very hard-working and decent lady. She is a responsible mother of four children, two daughters and two sons. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a restaurant, which is the only source of income for his family. He offers a variety of delicious and hygienic food in the restaurant. Sumaira is applying for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to buy cooking oil, beef, chicken and pulses (legumes) for making various dishes. With the expected profits from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually build a small house for his family. Sumaira hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase  cooking oil, beef, chicken and pulses (legumes) for making various dishes for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Bay

texts.en: Bay is 23 years old. He is a farmer’s son who lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Currently, he is employed in a security company as an administrative assistant. He makes an income of $4 daily. Bay dreams of becoming the owner of a restaurant. To achieve his dream, Bay has enrolled in Build Bright University, with a major in Business Management. With his current income, Bay can’t afford to pay all the expenses of his studies. With the loan of $270, Bay can pay for tuition and fees for one semester. This money will help him pursue his studies at the university and help him gain the ability to manage his own business. He hopes that he will be successful in his career, with his degree.

loans.use: to pay his tuition and fees to study business management.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 42 years old, is married and gifted with four children. She has owned and managed a restaurant in her village for almost two years.  She is happy that she can have a net income of Php1,000 a day.  She would like her business to become progressively more successful and this is why she is asking for a loan of Php10,000 to purchase condiments, food ingredients, and beverages for her restaurant. 

Vilma is hoping that she can make her business grow and earn more for her family.

loans.use: To purchase condiments, food ingredients and beverages for her restaurant

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa is from Militar, Tukuran. She is 43 years old, married, and has four children. To make a living, Ma. Theresa manages a fish-vending business, while her husband does the fishing. She joined GDMPC last year, and she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a new set of fishing nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new set of fishing nets.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 40 years old and lives in Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and the mother of a school-aged child. Vilma has a small store at home, selling groceries to make a living. She sells basic food items, such as canned goods, milk, coffee, sweets and biscuits. Vilma has been engaged in this business for years. She earns a total monthly average of PHP 2,200. Recently, she applied for a loan from GDMPC microcredit in the amount of 15,000 PHP, to buy rice and corn grits for sale. In the future, Vilma hopes to expand her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Brendan

texts.en: Brendan lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile ground for agriculture, located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has four children. He has practiced farming for over 25 years. His primary source of income is producing cereals. He says that the loan will help him buy a water tank and pipes, which will help him store enough water for his farm and thus facilitate more crop production. In five years, he intends to have his own store. The major challenges he faces are crop pests and diseases, and insufficient funds. This loan will improve his living standards. He appreciates Juhudi’s quick loan processing.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and pipes to improve his farm and increase production.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
After a difficult period during the economic downturn, Leah was able to reopen her esthetician business in 2011. Restarting her business after such difficult times has been especially rewarding, and admittedly, the second time around has been an incredible learning experience. “It opened up my mind and taught me the importance of reaching out for help. The resources are there!” 

Following the advice of her mom, an accountant, and her loan officer, Leah started using QuickBooks and created a detailed client database. These two changes freed up her time to focus on new marketing ideas and products for clients, including referral and discount programs. She sees that people are starting to spend more on personal care, but understands that in her business, cash flow can be unpredictable.  

For the last year, Leah has had her own booth at the salon. She has a permanent disability and having her own space has given her freedom over her schedule, to best serve clients and manage her disability. With the flexible schedule Leah has also been able to attend trade shows to keep up with trends in beauty products and services. She also recently started doing lash extensions. “This distinguishes me from other estheticians”, said Leah. “There are not many salons in my area that provide this service and make it affordable.” Her clients include moms who love the lash extensions. “They are looking to get the latest looks -- to get what celebrities have.” 

Leah is using the loan of $3,700 to purchase products and attend trade shows. It’s all part of a continuing education that she is committed to. “I have so much enthusiasm this time around. I’m fired up and full of creative ideas for the business. I love that I can help people feel beautiful, from the inside out. The second time around she has renewed faith that she will grow her business and one day achieve the dream of opening her own salon. I have always had a “never give up” attitude, shared Leah. “Now I know more and I am not afraid to ask for help.”

loans.use: to pay for products and attend trade shows.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia is 38 years old and a married woman. She is an active lady who is living with her husband and children in Lahore, Pakistan. She faced a real difficult time because her husband’s earnings were not enough to provide for his family. He has a small, cooking oil-selling shop in the area and this shop is the only source of income for his family.

Currently, Razia's husband needs to purchase cooking oil to sell since the stock of the store is almost finished. However, due to lack of funds, he finds it difficult to purchase more stock. Therefore, Razia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband. She is hopeful that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Dinesh

texts.en:
Dinesh and his wife, Nidhi, are originally from India and moved to the United States 10 years ago. 

In 2009, they opened their own business, Indigo, to prepare and sell their homemade Indian food. They currently sell their Indian food at two farmers markets in Washington, DC. Dinesh and his wife have gained a strong following at the farmer’s markets and their customers have requested that the couple establish their own brick and mortar restaurant. The couple found a location in Washington, D.C., and recently signed a lease to open their first Indian restaurant. The restaurant is scheduled to open this summer. 

The couple is requesting a $10,000 to purchase equipment such as a range, a refrigerator, a steam table, as well signage for the front of the restaurant. 

Dinesh and Nidhi have three children and in the future they plan to open additional Indian restaurants in the Washington, D.C. area.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for their new restaurant.

loans.name: Casarat

texts.en:
Casarat is 25 years old and married. He is a young client who lives with his parents and his wife in his home city. His wife is a housekeeper. Casarat has an interesting job taking videos at wedding ceremonies. His profit is 200 AZN. His income is the only income in his family and therefore, he tries often to go to wedding ceremonies. Casarat loves his business.

Casarat is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to buy a new, modern camera and new equipment for his business. This will be his second loan. He says, "I hope that only Kiva will help me to realize my dream." His loan will help further his love of video and help him attain his childhood dream of one day becoming a famous cameraman. Casarat awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new camera and equipment for his business

loans.name: Xayal

texts.en:
Xayal is 27 years old, married and the father of one son. 

His video business is very interesting. It is already seven years that he has been in this field. Xayal says that he loves his business because it is the only  income for his family. His profit from this business is 170 AZN for the month. 

When there is a wedding party, everybody calls Xayal to take their ceremony video. He is a professional man and doing it successfully. 

Xayal hopes to buy a new video camera because his camera is very old, but he hasn’t enough funds to get a new camera. In Azerbaijan, electronics are very expensive and because of that he can’t buy a camera with his salary.

He needs 1,900 AZN and hopes to realize his dream. Xayal awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new camera.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking mother who supports her husband in managing their farmland by planting vegetables for sale. They aim to improve their status of living in order to provide the educational needs of their children and give them a better life.  

She and her husband are planning to grow more vegetables to increase their production, but they have insufficient capital.  For this reason, Lydia is asking for additional capital of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and insecticides needed in vegetable production. Through hard work and strong determination, they believe that they will improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

location.town: Brgy. Nabetangan, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He has owned a poultry shop since 2009, where he sells delicious, fresh, chicken. He is the main income source for the family. He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to buy new equipment. These purchases will help him increase his business productivity, his sales, and thus his income. In the future, he looks forward to opening his own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his poultry shop.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 49-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a bus driver since 1988. His main route lies between his town and the surrounding villages; he also provides private transportation upon client request. His business income is very important, as he is the only income source for the family. He is applying to take out a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his bus, in order to carry on with his transportation business easily and safely. In the future, Jean looks forward to taking out another loan to renew his bus.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his bus.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marilou requested a 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, chips, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Ma. Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction). Ma. Lina is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to  buy more stock of bananas to sell for her buying and selling of bananas business.

Ma. Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Analyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming business.

NWTF is listing Analyn's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a teacher with many years of experience teaching at local school. She lives in a small village Marmashen with her two children: a 21-year-old daughter and a 19-year-old son. In order to tackle financial hardships, Armine is also engaged in agriculture. She keeps cows, pigs, and chickens on her farm and also cultivates wheat, barley, and potato on her own land. Armine is a very hardworking person and she likes her agricultural occupation. With the profits from her farm, she meets her family's needs and tries to ensure good a life for her children.

Armine is requesting a loan to purchase forage for her animals and also fuel to transport products to market. She waits for your support and she is sure that this loan will be a good motivator for her to continue farming.

loans.use: to purchase forage for her animals and fuel to transport products to market

loans.name: Sudarno

texts.en:
Sudarno lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta. Sudarno is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Sudarno runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. He began working with Ruma four months ago because he wanted to get more income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, he has made around $60 to $65 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is 58 years old and a widowed woman. She has a 2 children, one married daughter and a 28-year-old son. Sevil is a merchant. She sells household goods such as accessories for the home.

Sevil is a very hard working woman. She takes care of her kids and is a good mother. She working the whole day. After her husband's death her income became very small and because of that Sevil started to work. She has been in this field for ten years. Her neighbors were her first clients then day by day she expanded her business and opened a large market. Now she needs a loan of 1800 azn to buy more household products because people often ask her for a good which she doesn't have. This is her fifth loan and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more household products

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal, 53 years old, is a widow who lives with her parents, daughters and niece in her old brick house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

She made one part of her house into a grocery store where one of her daughters sells various kinds of food. Her elder daughter works at a private business entity. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair. So she is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as planks, bricks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she can repair and insulate her house because, during winter time, the family chills down to its core and she doesn't want her parents to get flu or any sickness. 

The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit fewer pollutants and thereby contribute to efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Sereenen

texts.en:
Sereenen is 33 years old and lives with his wife and a daughter in small house in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife, Saran, is 34 and works at a local beauty saloon as a hairdresser. His daughter, Duurenzaya, is 4 and goes to the local kindergarten. 

He has been working as a plumber in a local company since 2000. He also provides call service to local clients from time to time during his off-duty time. 

He and some of his colleagues are starting a business to take orders from apartment residents and provide utility services. He is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase tools and equipment to start his business successfully. He is a hardworking, honest and friendly man.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment to start his business successfully.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima variado, en el cual se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente  el cultivo de manzana, maíz amarillo, plátano, entre otros. Claudio es un joven con muchas ganas de progresar ya su familia es de bajos recursos económicos y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Computación e informática.

Cada día Claudio trabaja como obrero de un fundo agrícola, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar, Claudio trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, pero en época de cosecha trabaja alrededor de 10 horas; Claudio cree que esa saliendo adelante porque es responsable con su trabajo.

Claudio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá construir una pared de adoba para la parte posterior de su humilde vivienda ya que actualmente es solo de caña ; de esta manera podrá brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia y evitar que puedan asaltar su  vivienda, así el podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder y poder seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Claudio is a young man, 22 years old. He lives in the city of Imperial, which is known for its variable climate and for its agriculture, especially the cultivation of apples, yellow corn, and plantains, among other crops. Claudio is a young man with a great desire to make progress. His family has few economic resources, and because of this he was only able to study up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would have liked to study for a degree in Computing and Information Technology. 

Each day, Claudio works as a laborer on a farm, since with the earnings from his work he can help with the household expenses. Claudio works approximately 8 hours a day, but in the harvest season he works about 10 hours. Claudio believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible with his work. 

Claudio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to him, he will be able to build an adobe wall at the back of his humble home, where the current wall is only made of cane. In this way, he will be able to provide better security for his family and prevent burglaries. Thus he will be able to keep working to make his greatest dream a reality: "to finish his studies and continue supporting his family."

loans.use: to build a wall at the back of his home.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita is 51 years old and married with two children who are in school. For the past ten years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling rice and coconut wine. Jelita works hard to provide for her family and has repaid four previous loans from NWTF.

Jelita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, shampoo, and other products. She aspires to save money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, canned goods, shampoo, and other products

loans.name: Norma Yaneth

texts.es:
Norma, requiere de un nuevo préstamo  porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de tablilla tales como: azúcar, cacao y asimismo compra de lácteos entre estos están: crema, queso, cuajada, etc.
El crédito anterior le ayudo de forma positiva, ya que surtió mas el negocio adquiriendo mas mercadería por lo que la demanda ha incrementado; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que los ingresos han aumentado y las condiciones familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Norma needs a new loan for working capital to continue investing in her business.  It will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs to make chocolate bars: sugar and cacao.  She'll also buy dairy products, including cream, cheese, curd, etc.

The previous loan helped her in a positive way because she stocked her business more and acquired more merchandise, and demand has increased.  Her economic conditions have improved because her income improved, and her family conditions have optimized.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cacao, and dairy products

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste has been in business for three years, selling religious goods such as spiritual candles, holy oils and water, and other Christian-related items in her effort to bring the Holy Spirit to people’s lives.  

Her plans to expand her business by hiring additional employees and purchasing more products lead her to look for opportunity to find capital. One day an Accion Texas Inc. employee came in contact with Celeste and referred her to apply for a microloan to cover expenses. Once Celeste was approved for her Accion loan, she purchased more spiritual candles, holy water and oils, and continued to pay the salary of her one full-time employee.

Her next goal is to hire three part-time employees but for now, Celeste is taking it a day at a time. She says without the loan, “I would have not been able to purchase the extra inventory to maintain my current sales and increase my income.”

loans.use: to purchase more spiritual candles, holy water and oils, and continue to pay the salary of her one full-time employee.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man aged 46 with 5 children of whom 4 are attending school.

He is primarily concentrates on the agriculture business. He grows food for home use and enough extra to sale. He says he works 6 days a week excluding Sunday when he rests.
 
He says he has been in this business for the last 30 years and through this he has been able to expand his cultivated land by buying additional plots and also educating his children.

He says that the reason why he started this business is to take care of the needs of his family and he acquired this loan to buy manure for his plantation.

He says that his main clients are retail shops around his home area who sell bananas both raw and ripe which are consumed for all categories of people.

He describes himself as a hard working man. He was happy that interest rates were reduced and is excited that he will qualify for the partnership with Kiva. In the photograph Charles is with his wife on their banana plantation.

loans.use: To buy organic manure for his plantation

loans.name: Ghafooran

texts.en:
Ghafooran, age 55, is the leader of this borrower group. She is a very hardworking housewife and a mother of eight children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life.

Her husband owns a rice shop which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase rice for the store. However due to lack of income, he finds it difficult. 

That is why Ghafooran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan to purchase products for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to save money to pay for the school of children. Ghafooran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 66 años de edad, es una persona muy alegre y entusiasta y a pesar de su edad tiene un carisma contagiante y sobre todo tiene  muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es padre de 6 hijos, a los cuales quiere muchísimo, sobre todo porque ya han formado su propia familia y sus nietas son su adoración. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Francisco solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Enfermería.

Cada día Francisco apertura su pequeño negocio de venta de jugos y sándwich,  el se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana para poder preparar sus producto ya que las personas de su ciudad trabajan desde esas horas de la mañana; el puede llegar atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente y cree que está saliendo adelante porque tiene mucha fe en Dios y sobre todo porque tiene buena sazón.

Francisco esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar frutas al por mayor como manzana, plátano, papaya, entre otros, ya que sus clientes han aumentado y de esta manera podrá darles una mejor atención, así el seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Darle una profesión al menor de sus hijos y poder mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Francisco is 66 years old and is a very happy and enthusiastic person. In spite of his age he has a contagious charisma and above all, he has a great desire to get ahead. He is the father of six, all of whom he loves very much. They have all formed their own families now and his grandchildren are his adoration. Due to limited economic resources, Francisco was only able to study up to the fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to study a Nursing career. 

Every day Francisco opens his small business selling juice and sandwiches. He wakes up at five in the morning to prepare his products because many city inhabitants start work at this hour. He serves up to 25 customers a day and believes that he is getting ahead because he has a great faith in God and because his food is full of flavor. 

Francisco is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help brought forth, he will be able to buy fruits at wholesale prices including apples, plantains and papaya, among others. He has grown in customers and will be able to offer them better service with these purchases. He will continue working hard to make his greatest dreams a reality: to send his youngest child to school for a professional career and improve his home.

loans.use: to buy fruits at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Nerlie

texts.en:
Nerlie is 26 years of age. She generates income through her hog-fattening business. She usually earns around  5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for every hog she can sell.  

To further make her business grow, she is now requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy three piglets and a supply of feeds and vitamins. Nerlie hopes to keep improving her business and become successful someday for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice milling and a general store. Lorna is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josie works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Josie is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, milk, spices, cream, chips, and other items for her general store. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, spices, cream, chips, and other items

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives in a small village of Syuniq region with her husband, two sons, and mother-in-law. She is skilled and devoted to her work of running a farm. She keeps on her farm a pig and four cows and also cultivates wheat, onions, and greens. 

Alvard's husband tries to help his wife around their farm. She is sure that she can enlarge her farm and gather more profit. For this, she has requested this loan. With the help of the loan, Alvard will purchase three cows. She wants to get involved in production of dairy products as well, which is why this loan will help her very much. 

Alvard is sure that her hard work of many years someday will give her a farm of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Kirizestomu

texts.en:
Kirizestomu is 54 years old. He lives in Mpigi town. He has six children who are between the ages of 21 and 32. Other than his taxi  business, he also has rental property. 

He has already gotten three loans with the organization, and now wants to pay school  fees with this loan. He is glad that he now has to pay fees for only one of his children, since the others are no longer in school. 

His customers are passengers who commute daily to town. His dream is to buy more taxis. He currently has a challenge because new tariffs keep coming up. In the photograph is the loan officer (left) with the client.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Kithituni Women Group

texts.en:
Kithituni is a group of young women entrepreneurs engaged in a number of businesses ranging from farming to retail shops and clothing sales, among others.  Though their businesses are still viable, they saw an opportunity to expand by selling solar lamps to their community members.  In their rural setting where there is no electricity, promoting solar will be of double benefit since they will make some income from the sales as well as empower their community by encouraging green energy.  Families purchasing and using solar lamps will no longer have to buy or use kerosene or candles and hence can save money and improve their health.  The women's group will also be sustainable since profits will be ploughed back to grow their stock of solar lamps.  Their vision is to have a one-stop-shop for solar lamps in the region and also also create employment for their children.

Nicera, standing on the far left side, is a single mother who runs an electronics shop which she inherited from her father. She used this loan to purchase 24 lamps for resale and to get started in this business.  From the lamp sales she will be able to repay the loan and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To purchase solar lamps for resale

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.en:
Dagoberto, a native of El Salvador, arrived in the USA in 2000. He is married and has three children. 

After working in the construction industry for a year, he moved to Virginia where, since his arrival, he has been working in the field of heating and air conditioning. After Dagoberto acquired experience as a worker, foreman and supervisor, his boss suggested that he open his own company. As a result, Dagoberto created his own heating and air conditioning company. 

Currently, the company is negotiating contracts with larger companies, aiming to diversifying its customer base. One of the drawbacks that the company has faced in seeking larger contracts has been the need for equipment and cleaning materials. Dagoberto is soliciting a $10,000 loan for purchasing new equipment and supplies. This will enable him to make his company grow.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Milagro Guadalupe

texts.es:
Milagro, vive con sus padres, los cuales tienen edades de 65 y 73 años, todos trabajan en el negocio. Ella posee un molino y tienda  para obtener ingresos, el negocio lo realiza desde hace varios años atrás y es familiar. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para el molino y productos para la tienda tales como: frijoles, azúcar, arroz, entre otros; este le servirá para darle mantenimiento al molino y surtir la tienda para ofrecerle variedad de mercadería a sus clientes.
Su sueño es brindarles una mejor atención a sus padres, ya que dependen del negocio.
texts.en:
Milagro lives with her parents who are 65 and 73 years old. They all work in the business. She has a mill and store to earn income. The business has been around for several years and it is familiar.
The loan that she needs will allow her to invest in the purchase of mill parts and products for the store such as beans, sugar, rice, etc. This will allow her to do maintenance on the mill and stock the store to offer a variety of merchandise to her customers.
Her dream is to provide better care for her parents, as they depend on the business.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, part for the mill, etc.

loans.name: Santos Otilia

texts.es:
Doña Santos tiene 39 años de edad, ella es ama de casa y agricultora, madre de 6 hijos los cuales están pequeños y están en la escuela en diferentes grados de educación. En su compañía solo están sus hijos ya que actualmente ella está separada de su pareja y con sus hijos da el mantenimiento a sus cultivos entre otras actividades que ellos pueden hacer como: el corte, limpieza y abono. Ella curso hasta el segundo grado de educación primaria ya que el apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres era poco y no pudieron apoyarla para que culminara la primaria. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma área donde ella tiene construido su humilde hogar.

Ella solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, entre otros mediante un financiamiento solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL ya que es necesario para poder asegurar su cosecha.

Sus planes son los de poder dar un excelente mantenimiento a sus cultivos, convertirlos en una excelente plantación para poder sacar buenas cosechas cada vez que las haya. Sus sueños son los de darle a sus hijos una excelente educación ya que de esa forma ella podrá brindarles un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old. She is a stay-at-home mother who farms while taking care of her six school-aged children. Santos is separated from her husband and lives with her children. Together, Santos and her children take care of her crops. They help her with trimming, cleaning, and fertilizing them. Santos was only able to study through second grade because her parents could not afford to send her to school. 

Santos grows her crops right next to her home. She is requesting this loan from the cooperative COMIXMUL in order to buy fertilizers, compost, and other supplies. She hopes to turn her land into an excellent planting space so that each harvest will be of good quality. Santos' dream is to provide her children with a good education and, in this way, offer them a better future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to tend to her coffee plants.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunbileg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband, Erdene-Ochir, and older son, Duurenbayar, operate the family business of organic vegetable growing and selling on their plot of land. Her younger son, Gantomor, is 20 and a sophomore student of a local university. 

Oyunbileg has been growing organic vegetables as a family business for years and has a lot of experience in the business. She sells her products to local retailers. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase seeds and cover other costs regarding the plantation this season. She is planning to open a retail stall in a local market to sell her products directly to customers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and cover other costs regarding the plantation this season.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nyamaa is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger (Mongolian housing tent) in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband, Suren, is 43 years old and produces wooden furniture at home. Her daughter, Dolgorsuren, is 21, and son, Baldandorj, is 19; both of them study at universities. 

Nyamaa has been working as a saleswoman in a local grocery store for years and started her own grocery business in a rental stall of a local market. Since their family has two students and they are paying for both tuition and living expenses, the family income barely covers their expenses. She is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to pay her children's tuition fees and invest in her newly started grocery store business. She is a hardworking lady who wants to grow their children to be highly educated.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition fee and invest in her newly started grocery store business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. For more than 12 years now, she has also engaged in a rice farming business, together with her husband.

Alejandra is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her businesses, as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Musavuli  est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Tupendane», entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un technicien en métallurgie (Ajusteur). La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 9 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 fûts d’huile de palme. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Musavuli is the leader of the Tupendane business group. At age 47, she is an experienced entrepreneur, and the married mother of six children who all go to school. Her spouse is a metallurgical technician (adjustor). 

Musavuli sells palm oil from her home. She started this business about nine years ago with funds given to her by her husband. This new loan will allow her to buy two drums of palm oil. 

She would like to expand her activity, and she wants to ensure that her children are fed and educated. 

Musavuli is very thankful for Hekima’s support of small entrepreneurs through microfinancing.

loans.use: to buy two drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 29 years old and married with nine children. Six of her children are in school. For the past 20 years she has been in the food market business in the Philippines. Teresita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Teresita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and seasonings to sell at her food stall. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and seasonings to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Fanny Hermelinda

texts.es: Fanny reside en la ciudad de Guayaquil en el sector del suburbio, comenzó vendiendo ropa, después sus cliente le solicitaban otros productos, es así como su negocio creció y actualmente vende artículos varios para el hogar, este préstamo lo solicita para invertirlo en la educacion de sus hijos menores de edad, sus sueño a futuro es tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the city of Guayaqil in the Suburbio area.  She started out selling clothes.  Later, her customers requested other products from her.  This is how her business grew.  She currently sells various household items.

The loan that she is requesting is for her minor children’s education. Her dream for the future is to have her own house.

loans.use: to pay for her minor children's education.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a businesswoman. She has been operating a retail shop for the last two years in her home town of Malindi, Kenya. She sells items such as vegetables, rice, sugar, and flour. This single mother of a 10-year-old child is also employed and gets an income from the employment. She has a vision of owning a wholesale shop in the future. She seeks a loan to buy vegetables and sacks of sugar. She tells of the challenge that she faces as the low number of customers when the season is low. She is taking a loan from Kiva for the first time and she hopes that some day she will have enough to be able to lend too. Extra income raised from the loan use will go toward giving her family better living standards and helping her child to finish school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Benkadi  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  MAMOU , 1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 180.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi II Group are married women with an average age of 45 years, and an average of six children. They are all living in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages of Baguineda, second administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fifth loan cycle, and their prior loans have been repaid.

Mamou, shown seated on the far left in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers.

Mamou hopes to earn an income of 180,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for several years now. This is the source of her family's income. Alicia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Lilian. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 3. In 2003, Lilian established her cotton fabric business. She began her business because she was not educated. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 300,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Lilian requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of textile cottons of different qualities for resale. In the future, Lilian plans to develop her plots of land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of textile cottons of different qualities

loans.name: Ana Elsy

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos, los cuales están estudiando  y dos de ellos dependen de ella. Ana, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y semilla de marañón, esta actividad la realiza desde hace mucho atrás para el sustento diario para su familia.
El préstamo que requiere le permita comprar maíz y semilla de marañón para ofrecerles a los clientes;  esta le ayudara a mantener un mejor inventario, ya que obtendrá buenos resultados.
Su sueño es construir más cuartos a su casa.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and their three children.  The children go to school, and two of them are dependent upon her.  She sells tortillas and cashews.  She has been engaged in this business activity for many years in order to support her family every day.

The loan that she needs will allow her to buy corn and cashews to sells to her customers.  This will help her to keep a better inventory and to get better results.

Her dream is to build more rooms onto her house.

loans.use: to buy corn and cashews.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 52 years old and married with two children. For almost 30 years, she has owned and managed a retail store in her village. 

Prescila is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to make her business more profitable. She will use her loan to purchase cooking oil, condiments, canned goods, beverages, and other basic commodities.  Prescila is hoping that the lenders will grant her loan request so she can make her business grow and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, condiments, canned goods, beverages, and other commodities

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old and not married. He has no children. For the past three years, Joseph has run a hotel and bar. He has been able to save whatever money he earns to improve his business. Joseph appears in this photograph with his loan officer.

Joseph is requesting a loan to complete construction on his hotel. He often gets more customers than he can accommodate, and therefore it is very necessary for him to finish constructing his half-built lodges. Joseph hopes to increase his earnings in the future.

loans.use: to complete construction on his lodges

loans.name: Idilicia

texts.es:
Idilicia, de 36 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Juan y sus 3 hijos en la casa que alquiló desde hace 3 años. Como buena mujer del campo siembra toda clase de hortalizas en los terrenos que alquila en su localidad. Comenta que ahora le resulta mucho más fácil trasladar la cosecha, pues la ruta a la ciudad se centralizó por esa zona. “Ahora nos visitan muchos compradores de diversas ciudades, es mucho más fácil comercializar a buen precio”, comenta. El mayor anhelo que tiene es poder comprar una pequeña carpa donde pueda vender comidas por las noches, pues nadie se dedica a ello. Espera lograr su objetivo pues quiere ocupar sus tardes y aprovecharlas, ya que en la mañana se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos. Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y agradece el apoyo recibido ya que le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Idilicia, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Idilicia, 36 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Juan, and their three children in a house that they have been renting for the last three years. Like any good woman from the countryside, Idilicia grows all kinds of vegetables on the land she rents. She mentions that now it is much easier to transport her crops because the route leading into the city passes by this area, "Now many buyers from different cities visit us so it's easier to sell at good prices."

Idilicia's biggest desire is to be able to buy a small tent from which she can sell food at night since currently no one provides this service. She hopes to achieve this goal because it would take advantage of her free evenings. Idilicia tends to her crops in the mornings. 

This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the support because it will help her increase her earnings. Idilicia pledges to make her repayments on time. She will invest the 500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Isata. She is married and has three children ages 16, 18, and 20. In 2004, Isatu established a business selling rice by the bag. She began her business to help her husband with some family issues. Isata's business is located in Center Town and her main customers are general community members. She works seven days a week, ten hours a day and earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month.

Isata is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to buy more bags of rice of different kinds to sell. In the future, she plans to open another shop that will be managed by a salesperson. Isata thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice of different kinds to sell

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAN III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’ arachide  avec MARIAM , 4 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché , après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 200.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi III Group are married women with an average age of 40 years, and an average of five children. They are all living in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages of Baguineda, second administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fifth loan cycle.

Mariam, shown standing the fourth from the left in the photo, grows crops of peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers.

Mamou hopes to earn an income of 200,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one and a half hectares of farmland.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie est leader du groupe d’affaire  « Ujamaa», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un vendeur de carburant (petit pétrolier). La cliente est vendeuse des poissons. Elle installe ses produits au marché et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 paniers de poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une seconde parcelle. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, by the name of Marie, is the leader of the Ujamaa business group. She is an experienced young entrepreneur, 34 years old, married and the mother of seven children, all of whom are in school. Her husband sells fuel (gas). Marie sells fish. She sets up her produce at the market and sometimes by her home. She has launched her business with her own starting capital received from her husband about six years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy four baskets of fish. She would like to expand her business, provide for the education and food for her children and purchase a second land plot. Finally, she expresses her heartfelt thanks to Hekima for its microloans supporting small business owners.

loans.use: to buy four baskets of fish.

loans.name: Kadie

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Kadie.  She is married and has two children ages four and six. In 2009, Kadie established a business selling food and drink. She began her business to assist her husband in taking care of their home. Kadie's business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are men and women. She works seven days a week, 12 hours a day and earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month. 

Kadie is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to buy more food and drink to sell. In the future, she plans to build a house. Kadie thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy food and drink to sell

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Massa. She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 6. In 2011, Massa established her business selling rice, salt, maggi (bouillon), sugar, etc. She began her business because she wants to help assist her husband in the running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 550,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Massa requires a loan in order to  purchase more rice, maggi, etc. for resale. In the future, Massa plans to travel to other countries, buy goods in large quantities, and sell at wholesale to make more profit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase more rice, maggi, etc. for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  3 membres du groupe  BENKADI IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO, un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec  KODIE , 2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché , après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The three members of the Benkadi IV Group are married women with an average age of 35 years, and an average of six children. They are all living in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages of Baguineda, second administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their fifth loan cycle, and their past loans have been repaid in full.

Kodie, shown standing in the middle in the photo, grows crops of millet. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village market to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers.

Kodie hopes to earn an income of 125,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for they labor needed to maintain one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Tocte  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tocte está formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Jadan en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de mucha vegetación y de verdes campos, su gente es muy trabajadora, se dedican en especial a la crianza de animales, a la agricultura y a la elaboración de sogas, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades, su orgullo es aun mantener viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Ana, es una  socia fundadora que forma parte del grupo de crédito Tocte, grupo en el cual ha establecido una gran amistad con todas sus vecinas y compañeras de la comunidad, los créditos le han permitido crecer en su negocio. 

Doña María Ana tiene 41 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 15, 9 y 6 años, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora María Ana se dedica a la tarea que aprendió de sus padres que es la agricultura, siembra y cosecha hortalizas las que vende en su comunidad, también cría cerdos, cuyes y pollos. 

Su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de abono, semillas y alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.

El señor con chompa gris que esta en la última fila de la foto es el esposo de la socia que falta en la fotografía.
texts.en:
The Tocte communal bank is comprised of nine women and one man.  These members live on the outskirts of the Jadan parish in Cuenca.  This place is surrounded by a lot of vegetation and green fields.  Its people are very hard-working.  Specifically, they raise animals, farm, and make ropes.  Many people work in the city by engaging in different business activities.  Their pride is still keeping the culture and traditions of their villages alive.

María Ana is a member of this group.  She is a founding member who is part of the Tocte group loan.  In this group she has established a great friendship with all of her neighbors and colleagues in the community.  The loans have allowed her to grow in her business.

María Ana, age 41, is married.  They have three children, ages 15, 9, and 6.  Her first daughter goes to high school, and the last two children go to an elementary school in the area.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  They live in their own house.

María Ana devotes herself to the work that she learned from her parents, farming.  She grows and harvest vegetables, which she sells in her community.  She also raises pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and feed for her animals.  Her goal is to expand her business.

The man with the gray jacket in the last row of the photo is the husband of the member who is not in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en:
